FULL TITLE : PUERTO PRINCESA : THE GATEWAY TO PALAWAN'S TOURISM HUBS
SHORT TITLE : Tourism Industry
ABSTRACT : Rep. Acosta ... emphasized how the travel and tourism industry has contributed to the country’s gross domestic product and attracted millions of foreign visitors. He stressed that his province, Palawan, has been in the forefront of tourism boom, and that Puerto Princesa City,...is the gateway thereto, with a multitude of tourist facilities and historical landmarks. He mentioned in particular the Puerto Princesa Underground River which is a UNESCO World Heritage site and considered one of the Seven Wonders of Nature, as well as the El Nido Reserve and the Coron island. Rep. Acosta presented the ff. suggestions to help maximize the tourism potentials of Palawan and the City of Puerto Princesa...: 1) a policy program to expand and intensify secondary attractions and projects that must be supported by the national government; 2) a plan or program to improve infrastructure facilities in Palawan such as a cruise port facility that could cater to tourists and visitors; and 3) a measure declaring Palawan as the ecological tourism capital of the Philippines. (SOURCE: House Journal No. 22,pp.11-12)
